moves.1. d4 Nf6 2. c4 e6 3. Nc3 Bb4: The Nimzo-Indian, an aggressive and tricky line.
moves.4. Qb3: White counters equally aggressively. If Black exchanges, White gains a minor exchange at no cost.
moves.4... c5: Black defends the Bishop, but cuts off its retreat.
moves.5. a3: Trying to force the Bishop away.
moves.5... Qa5: Counterthreat! Now PxB would be answered with ...QxR.
moves.6. Bd2: Adding a defender to the Knight.
moves.6... Nc6 7. Qd1: Black's best line is 7... BxN 8 BxB Q-Q1 9 P-Q5, leaving White with a good game.
moves.7... Nxd4: Setting a trap: 8 PxB? QxR! 9 QxQ N-B7 ch winning the Q and ending up ahead an Exchange.
moves.8. e3: Now, however, White wins a piece! If the Knight retreats, White plays 9 PxB. If Black tries 8... BxN, 9 BxB forks Q and N and White still wins a piece! Black resigns at once.
